page.title: 01Bentfield Bury Farm
page.content: We visited Bentfield Bury Farm where Mr Brett is the manager. We asked him questions and this is the information we received. The farm covers 750 acres. Ten acres of the farm is woodland,in the woods are oak trees. The pheasants are shot in the woodland. They get 500 bales of hay per year from the fields. Five acres will hold 238 ewes. The ewes are out all the time, in all weathers. Over last winter they lost 14 ewes so that they only had 224 ewes. On the farm they have 323 lambs as well. There are two unused pits. They used to be used for chalk, but now waste is put in them. The waste comes from potatoes and sugarbeet. They get 1,000 tons of waste per year. There are two ponds on the farm, they are used for putting out fires. The fields have to be weed free as
